Job Title: INTERNSHIP - FINANCE & AUDIT (M/F/D)
Job Description:
Step into the dynamic world of sports with an internship in Finance at our Headquarter in Herzogenaurach! Applicants are considered for the Finance intern roles in our global HQ. 
 
You may find yourself contributing to various areas such as Financial Planning & Analysis, Corporate Controlling, Demand Planning or Internal Control Systems (Audit). From working on financial statements and reports, to KPI, performance and risk analyses and engaging in conducting data evaluations as part of ICS testing and monitoring to conclude on the effectiveness of existing processes and controls, there will be many opportunities for you to explore your passion for numbers and analytical thinking.  
 
Your collaborative spirit will shine as you build cross-functional relationships with business stakeholders. Take the opportunity to have an impact through improvement suggestions and enthusiasm for innovative ideas! 
 
Whether you're supporting the ongoing revision of the adidas’ global key control framework, the development and enhancement of financial reports and dashboards or assist in preparing financial reporting and communication to internal stakeholders, senior leadership and / or external audiences, your role will be integral in shaping the success of our brand in the dynamic world of sports.  
 
Join us in driving excellence and innovation! 
 
GROW YOUR CAPABILITIES THROUGH MEANINGFUL TASKS & PROJECTS  


Financial Analysis and Reporting Support: 
- Perform financial analyses for strategic decision-making. 
- Prepare reports on business plans, budgets, performance, and forecasts. 
- Develop tools and dashboards to improve processes and insights availability. 
- Assist in creating internal and external financial reporting / statements. 
 


Business Partnering and Decision Support: 
- Provide insights for Business Partners and / or Senior Management. 
- Enable fact-based decision-making process by defining, analyzing, and creating transparency on KPIs. 
- Identify risks and opportunities and derive recommended action steps for stakeholders. 
- Develop and implement communication packages to present results, recommendations, and solutions. 


 


Internal Control Systems: 
- Assist in revising adidas' global key control framework and enhancing internal controls through digitalization and automation initiatives.
	- Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify process risks, conduct risk analyses, and suggest remediation actions for control deficiencies.
	- Support internal audit assessments, follow up on remediation plans, and seek guidance from the Corporate Internal Audit team.


 
WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A MATCH 

Student of Business Administration, Economics, or Finance with a focus on Finance, Controlling, Accounting or related fields. 
Fluent in English (written and spoken), German proficiency is a plus. 
Strong MS Office skills, with advanced proficiency in Excel. 
Knowledge of Alteryx, MicroStrategy and Power BI is beneficial. 
Strong analytical skills and ability to grasp tasks quickly. 
Excellent communication and organizational skills.

Job Title: SALES ASSISTANT (M/F/D) VOLLZEIT 39h BEFRISTET 2 JAHRE - FACTORY OUTLET, HERZOGENAURACH
Job Description:
Zweck & Gesamtrelevanz für die Organisation: 
 
Trägt durch Folgendes dazu bei, die Verkaufszahlen und KPI-Ziele zu erreichen oder zu übertreffen: 


Baut eine emotionale Verbindung zu den Kunden auf und lebt die Markenwerte 




Bedient Kunden, verkauft und führt Store-Abläufe gewissenhaft durch 


 
Verantwortlichkeiten:  
 


Kennt die Store-Ziele und und die individuellen Ziele und arbeitet aktiv daran, diese zu erreichen oder zu übertreffen, nutzt dabei alle zur Verfügung stehenden Ressourcen 




Erfüllt oder übertrifft die Erwartungen der Kunden und treibt Abverkäufe sowie Markenbekanntheit nach oben, in dem er/sie geeignete Elemente des Customer Leitbildes anwendet 




Baut zu jedem Kunden eine emotionale Bindung auf, indem er/sie als leidenschaftlicher und enthusiastischer Botschafter der Marke auftritt 




Lässt in seinem/ihrem Store-Bereich aktiv Basiswissen und Fakten über Saisonprodukte in den Serviceansatz einfließen 




Erhält ein ansprechendes, angenehmes Umfeld aufrecht, in dem die Kunden gerne einkaufen und achtet dabei auf Visual Merchandising sowie Ordnung und Sauberkeit  




Hält sich an die Regeln und Abläufe (SOM-Regelungen), die für den Store gelten und erhält eine sichere Einkaufs- und Arbeitsatmosphäre aufrecht 




Stellt sicher, dass das Warenangebot für den Kunden verfügbar ist, indem er/sie hilft, wenn Ware geliefert wurde und die Verkaufsfläche aufgefüllt werden muss 




Minimiert Verluste, indem er/sie beim Bedienen von Kunden immer auf den Warenbestand achtet 




Arbeitet neue Mitarbeiter/-innen ein (falls zutreffend) 




Arbeitet produktiv und respektvoll mit Teammitgliedern zusammen, um die Ziele des Stores zu erreichen oder zu übertreffen 




Absolviert alle vorgeschriebenen Trainingsprogramme und wendet diese erfolgreich bei seiner/ihrer Arbeit an 




Signalisiert fortwährende Lernbereitschaft und nutzt alle angebotenen Möglichkeiten, um seine/ihre Entwicklung voranzutreiben und seine/ihre Performance zu verbessern 




Kassiertätigkeit (falls zutreffend) 




Stellt korrekte Bezahlungsabläufe inkl. sorgsamer Warenhandhabung sicher 




Führt Kassenabschlüsse sorgfältig durch 




Schließt Verkäufe schnell und exakt ab und hält sich an die vorgegebenen Richtlinien zur Sicherung des Geldbestandes (falls zutreffend) 




Endless Aisle (falls zutreffend) Informiert Kunden über die neue Bestell-/Verkaufsmöglichkeit im Online Shop und verwendet das Endless Aisle Tablet um Produktbeschreibungen und/oder Kundenfeedback über Produkte während dem Verkaufsprozess anzubieten. 




Click & Collect (falls zutreffend) Überwacht und überschaut neue Onlinebestellungen, die von Onlinekunden bestellt wurden und im Laden reserviert, gepackt und an den Kunden im Laden ausgegeben werden müssen. 




Ship from Store (falls zutreffend) Überwacht und überschaut neue Onlinebestellungen, die an die Kunden per Lieferung geschickt werden müssen.  


 
Befugnisse: 
 


NA 


 
Vorwiegende Kontakte:  
 


Kunden 




Kollegen/-innen und Vorgesetzte 


 
 
Kenntnisse, Fertigkeiten und Fähigkeiten:  
 


Kompetenzen eines Retail Professionals 




Erwartungsheft für RP 


 
 
Benötigte Ausbildung und Erfahrung / Mindestanforderung:  
 


0-3 Jahre Retail Erfahrung 




Ausbildung zum Verkäufer wünschenswert 




Englisch Grundkenntnisse 




Grundlegende Rechtschreib- und Rechenkenntnisse, Kommunikationsfähigkeit

Job Title: Developer Apparel - Running/Credibility Sports (m/f/d)
Job Description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization:
 
We’ll never launch a product unless we consider it perfect. Our product development teams create every shirt, every shoe and every piece of equipment for thousands of athletes and fashion lovers as if it was one of a kind. And it truly is, as they weave their passion into every single product. But translating designs, drawings and renderings into real products requires a lot of decision making.
 
As Developer Apparel, you will (1) drive the end-to-end development process for assigned low  complexity products from concept brief to production readiness and (2) assist in driving the development of medium complexity products. You will work in strong partnership with pattern and material experts as well as product marketing, design and suppliers.
 
With the support of experienced team members and on-the-job training, you will have the possibility to take over increasing responsibilities and grow into the role  of a Manager Development Apparel.
 
Key Responsibilities: 
 

Take accountability for the entire apparel development management process for assigned products, with an emphasis on product integrity, product engineering and timely completion of all tasks in accordance with the corporate operating calendar. Apply sport-specific understanding to enhance product performance.
Manage fit approval and size specification process, lead fitting meeting and take decisions on workmanship and construction.
Assist in providing technical solutions by analyzing designs for manufacturability, production and material properties which address desired function and market appeal. 
Manage handover of design pack to T1 to ensure that all technical information provided to T1 is complete. 
Act as technical expert and guide/consult design and product marketing on T1 manufacturing efficiency suggestions. Manage comments to T1.
Research innovation from market or suppliers regarding garment construction, pattern, fit, embellishment and trims. Partner with Innovation, Sourcing, Tier-1 and Tier-2 suppliers to implement into product creation.
Review, validate and approve T1 costing information to ensure products are engineered in accordance with cost targets throughout the entire creation process. Secure initial FOB cost quotes and follow-up price adjustments. Negotiate  final costs with T1 as needed. 
Ensure that all fabrics, trims, colors, processes and development samples are fully tested to ensure adherence to adidas’ quality and testing standards.
Manage quality and process escalations with senior manager as needed.
If required, review size sets for accuracy of measurements and merchantability of complete size range for fit. 
Review and sign off sealing sample with complete AD including all related documents prior to buy ready dates.
Ensure full conformity to published policies to ensure a final legal AD for final product
Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness of data by continuously updating the system. 
Responsible for achieving specific KPIs (e.g. margins , sustainability, and on-time SMS delivery) for assigned articles/produc

 
Key Relationships: 
 

Product Design
Product Marketing
Product Operations (Product Development, Materials Development, Pattern Making, Testing & Quality, Costing, Planning)
Sourcing
Tier 1 supplier
Digital Creation

 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
 

Basic knowledge of material construction and related testing
Basic knowledge of wear and physical product testing  

Basic knowledge of production garment construction and manufacturing 


Ability to fit a garment and comment to T1 on changes required 


Basic knowledge of costing and ability to negotiate as required

Effective communication and negotiation skills
English language proficiency required (reading and writing)
Strong IT skills (MS Office) and ability to work with Product Data Management Systems
Domestic and International Travel as required

 
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications: 
 

University degree in clothing technology or manufacturing, or technical degree as apparel technician
Alternatively, combination of relevant education, experience, and training
First practical experience through internships or work experience required

Fluent in English 
PC skills (MS Office programs, especially PowerPoint and Excel)

Job Title: Senior Creative Producer - Creative Direction - Brand Creative - x 2 (m/f/d)
Job Description:
We are looking for a Senior Creative Producer to join the Global Brand Creative team with an agency background to join our expanding creative department at the heart of adidas. 
 
Our team works to set the visual look, tone and feel for adidas on a global level, across the edges of sport and the culture it inspires. We are looking for someone familiar with these worlds with demonstrated capabilities in aiding the creation and delivery of impactful branded content to a global audience. 
 
This role is pivotal in our creative team, closely alligning with designers, art directors and design directors; both internally and externally, to support not only the creation of content but also the delivery of Brand Direction guidance to help steer and drive teams. 
 
The successful candidate will be experienced with working with a strong brand direction and adhering to tight delivery deadlines. They will also possess excellent organisational, negotiation, budget and project management skills, as well as have a keen understanding of the workstreams involved in creating engaging content across channels.
 
 
Key Responsibilities: 
 

Researching, planning and delivering creative projects from creative direction to content creation across multiple touch points, from 2D to retail, digital to motion in close collaboration with the Creative Director.  
Ensuring the brand's tone, look, and feel are consistently applied across all channels and touchpoints. Developing and maintaining brand guidelines and ensuring they are adhered to in all creative outputs. 
Leading the execution of creative strategies end to end from conceptualization, development, and production, ensuring creative excellence. From writing clear and compelling briefs, to ensuring feedback is integrated into development and driving successful creative delivery.  
Managing multiple projects simultaneously, maximizing results and ensuring timely delivery within budget and fulfilling creative objectives and brief. 
Mentoring and leading creative project managers, fostering a collaborative and inspiring environment within direct team and the wider department 
Staying up to date with industry trends and incorporate relevant knowledge and solutions into creative processes. 
Presenting and communicating objective creative solutions with clarity, effectively selling in ideas to a variety of stakeholders and senior leaders 
Identifying opportunities for change and improvement, and initiate own proposals 
Working with external agencies and vendors (copywriters, production house, photographers, directors etc) to ensure high-quality production and delivery. Fostering strong working relationships to help aid successful delivery. Seeking new external resources that can deliver world class results 
Securing and overseeing all production requirements for filmed, digital, experiential and immersive productions from pre- through post-production inclusive of footage, music and font licensing.

 

Maintaining high standards for all creative output, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and brand alignment. 

 
 
 
Key Relationships: 
 

Brand Creative Operations team 


Brand Creative Design team 


Brand Communications 


Brand Marketing Operations 


Business Units 


Market teams 


Retail 


Legal 


External vendors (freelancers and agencies) 

 
 
Personal Attributes: 
 
Team Player: Collaborative attitude with a willingness to learn and support team goals. 
Adaptable: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously. 
Proactive: Takes initiative and seeks out opportunities to contribute to the team's success. 
Passionate: Enthusiastic about creative production and eager to grow in the field. 
 
 
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: 

Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines. 


Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities. 
Proven negotiation skills relating to talent booking, image/ music licensing and contracting with suppliers.


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. 


Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and project management tools/software is a plus. 


Ability to influence regardless of reporting lines 


Language: English fluent 

 
Qualifications: 
 

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Media Production, or related field. 


At least 8 years experience working in design related area (agency or company) 


Strong interest in creative production and project management. 


Experience in organising photoshoots

Job Title: Senior Internal Auditor (m/f/d)
Job Description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization:

This is an exciting position that will directly contribute to the Corporate Internal Audit (CIA) mission to provide independent, objective assurance to improve the effectiveness of business risk management, internal controls, and governance processes throughout adidas. 
 
The Senior Internal Auditor will work in a project team to complete assurance and advisory projects under the supervision of a Manager or Senior Manager.
 
This position offers learning, development, and creation opportunities in an international environment within a multi-cultural, sports enthusiastic team that values inclusion and diversity. The team embraces change and innovation to support the company mission to be the best sports company in the world. 
 
Corporate Internal Audit team members are value-adding business partners focused on supporting adidas in creating a sound governance, risk and compliance framework which secures achievement of strategic objectives.
 
Key Responsibilities: 

•    Support and execute with limited supervision all phases of audit projects i.e. planning, execution, completion & reporting, and follow-up as assigned. Complete quality, thorough and fact-based documentation of project work throughout all deliverables.
•    Planning: participate in audit risk assessments and project scope definition; organize and attend planning inquiry meetings; collect and review relevant information in advance of project; document relevant information supporting the final audit risk assessment and project scope definition; actively support opening presentation preparation.
•    Fieldwork: execute audit procedures and work programs timely; conclude project work with fair and objective results including audit rating; update Project Lead and Project Reviewer on all key observations and clear all coaching and development notes from working papers; update observations, validate issues and collaboratively identify solutions with stakeholders (e.g. audit entity management and HQ functions).
•    Completion & Reporting: document detailed observations and recommendations; contribute to the closing presentation/audit report content  based on work performed during fieldwork; support the Project Lead in determining the audit rating; present topics of responsibility during audit closing meeting; perform cross-review and quality check of completed deliverables as appropriate.
•    Follow-up: monitor the implementation of audit recommendations.
•    Continuously expand and upgrade knowledge and skills by utilizing resources such as reading materials, and attending training workshops.
•    Enhance day-to-day processes and suggest improvement opportunities, develop and enhance internal audit tools (audit programs, testing templates), share best practices.
•    Support delivery of small-scale to medium-scale team initiatives (e.g. risk models, audit system updates).
•    Obtain breadth of understanding of key processes, systems, initiatives and business models and continuously develop professional expertise.
•    Act as point of contact for Interns and Guest Auditors.
 
Key Relationships: 

•    Senior Management and team members of the audit entities
•    Global support functions including Sales, Brand, Finance, TECH, Human Resources, and Operations
•    Key Governance functions: Risk Management, Policies & Internal Controls, Legal & Compliance
•    Corporate Internal Audit team
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 

•    Solution-oriented, adaptable, self-motivated, driven and committed team player with integrity and perseverance. Able to accept and meet deadlines, involving effective time management capacity and sense of priorities and agility.
•    Good analytic capabilities to manage large volume of information from various sources (interviews, data) and derive meaningful observations . Experience with data analytics extremely beneficial.
•    Good interpersonal skills combined with a high degree of customer orientation; can adapt and navigate easily within a changing environment and complex organizations; able to connect with a variety functions, audiences, management styles, or cultures and create/foster stakeholder relationships. 
•    Curious and growth mindset, keen to learn and approach subjects outside of comfort zone, able to think critically and bring in different perspectives (e.g. transferable skills).  
•    Comfortable to present and communicate in English effectively, both in writing and verbally. 
•    Additional language skills would be advantageous (e.g. German, Mandarin, Spanish, etc.).
•    Mobile; business related travel up to 40% per year.
 
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications: 

•    University degree in a business-related discipline (e.g. Accounting/Controlling/Finance, Management, Business Administration,  International Business etc.) 
•    2+ years of assurance, advisory or consulting experience, preferably within a multi-national organization or professional services firm. 
•    Strong interest, passion or practical experience in consumer products industry, diverse sales channels and brands (e.g. Tech, Fraud, Supply Chain, Wholesale, Retail, eCommerce, Digital, Finance). 
•    Obtained or working towards professional designations (e.g. CIA, CPA, CISA, CFE, etc.)

Curiosity for science and engineering along with a passion for making insights in the field of sport
Fluent English (required), German (advantageous)
Footwear development experience advantageous
Communicate and negotiate effectively
Cooperate well, develop and maintain relationships
Work independently as well as part of a team
Plan working time efficiently, balancing short term tasks with long term goals
Strong analytical skills, solution driven and result oriented
Ability to travel domestically and internationally


QUALIFICATIONS

University degree in a relevant field
3 years of working experiences

Job Title: Manager Development Apparel -  Originals SMU (m/f/d)
Job Description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organisation
We’ll never launch a product unless we consider it perfect. Our product development teams 
create every shirt, every shoe, and every piece of equipment for thousands of athletes and 
fashion lovers as if it was one of a kind. And it truly is, as they weave their passion into every 
single product. But translating designs, drawings and renderings into real products requires a 
lot of decision making.

As Manager Development Apparel, you will lead the end-to-end development process for 
assigned medium complexity products from concept brief to production readiness. You will work 
in strong partnership with pattern and material experts as well as product marketing, design,
and suppliers.
 

Key Responsibilities: 
• Take accountability for the entire apparel development management process for assigned 
products, with an emphasis on product integrity, product engineering and timely completion 
of all tasks in accordance with the corporate operating calendar. Apply sport-specific 
understanding to enhance product performance.
• Manage fit approval and size specification process, lead fitting meeting and take decisions
on workmanship and construction.
• Provide technical solutions by analyzing designs for manufacturability, production and 
material properties which address desired function and market appeal. 
• Manage handover of design pack to T1 to ensure that all technical information provided to T1 
is complete. 
• Act as technical expert and guide/consult design and product marketing on T1
manufacturing efficiency suggestions. Manage comments to T1.
Datum: Nov 2023 Seite 2 von 6
• Research innovation from market or suppliers regarding garment construction, pattern, fit, 
embellishment, and trims. Partner with Innovation, Sourcing, Tier-1 suppliers to implement 
into product creation.
• Review, validate and approve T1 costing information to ensure products are engineered in 
accordance with cost targets throughout the entire creation process. Secure initial FOB cost 
quotes and follow-up price adjustments. Ensure final costs adhere to adidas costing 
standard.
• Ensure that all fabrics, trims, colors, processes, and development samples are fully tested 
to ensure adherence to adidas’ quality and testing standards.
• Manage quality and process escalations with senior manager as needed.
• If required, review size sets for accuracy of measurements and merchantability of complete 
size range for fit. 
• Review and sign off sealing sample with complete AD including all related documents prior 
to buy ready dates.
• Ensure full conformity to published policies to ensure a final legal AD for final product.
• Ensure accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of data by continuously updating the system. 
• Responsible for achieving specific KPIs (e.g., on-time buy ready, target FOB, margins, 
sustainability, and on-time SMS delivery, CR2 finalization) for assigned articles/product.
• Live and foster a knowledge sharing culture, and mentor junior team members.
• Support cross-functional projects as required.

Key Relationships: 
• Product Design
• Product Marketing
• Product Operations (Product Development, Materials Development, Pattern Making, Testing 
& Quality, Costing, Planning)
• Sourcing
• Tier 1 supplier
• Digital Creation

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
• Advanced knowledge of material construction and related testing
• Advanced knowledge of wear and physical product testing 
• Advanced knowledge of production garment construction and manufacturing 
• Ability to fit a garment and comment to T1 on changes required 
• Advanced knowledge of costing and ability to negotiate as required
• Effective communication and negotiation skills
• Fluent in English (written and spoken) 
• Strong IT skills (MS Office) and ability to work with Product Data Management Systems
• Domestic and International Travel as required
 

Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications: 
• University degree in clothing technology or manufacturing, or technical degree as apparel 
technician.
• Alternatively, combination of relevant education, experience, and training.
• Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience in apparel product development

Job Title: Pattern Engineer Apparel | Athlete Servicing (m/f/d) || Advanced Creation
Job Description:
We’ll never launch a product unless we consider it perfect. Our product development teams create every shirt, every shoe and every piece of equipment for thousands of athletes and fashion lovers as if it was one of a kind. And it truly is, as they weave their passion into every single product. But translating designs, drawings and renderings into real products requires a lot of decision making.
As Pattern Engineer Apparel, you will drive the 2D and 3D pattern creation process for innovative and complex products in strong partnership with marketing, design, product development and suppliers. You will support the business unit’s strategy and global framework by driving processes, standards and methodologies in collaboration with the cross-functional team to achieve the goals and a consistent brand identity through quality, fit, speed and value for the business units’ products. You will implement company’s strategic business and systems direction into digital through product creation and technical infrastructure for apparel. You will train and advise product development teams and Tier 1 suppliers on the 2D and 3D pattern creation process. 
 
Key Responsibilities: 

Lead and drive the basic pattern process and selection to understand future business needs and determine future basic pattern requirements.
Support the global basic pattern process with special focus on fit consistency. 
Evaluate, create, and implement standard grading rules to ensure consistency in fit and contributes actively in terms of fit/general pattern guidelines. 
Develop new basic and/or new model patterns, drive the pattern creation 2D and 3D with cross-functional partners based on market requirements; maintain the information in the product creation system and ensure that new patterns are wear tested as needed.
In collaboration with all global pattern teams consolidate basic patterns across all business units, ensure aligned needs of all creation centers and be a contact for all basic pattern related topics for assigned category.
Drive new solutions to reach creative pattern goals, by using new methods and systems and/or new constructions
Understand and consider relationship between pattern/material properties & usage/yields during pattern creation to ensure best fit and best margin.
Support digital pattern projects, including tool development and smart solutions to enable the future of digital creation.
Manage to develop and implement processes and frameworks. 
Advise and train marketing, design and product developement on pattern and fit updates and problem-solving.
Monitor performance, train and advise on pattern creation and grading for area of responsibility.
Develop training plans and manuals for the global pattern and product development teams in collaboration with the horizontal pattern team (i.e., how to measure manual).
Mentor junior team members in 2D and 3D pattern making and fit.
Create virtual prototypes to increase speed and efficiency of the product creation process.
Manage the testing of new patterns and garment constructions in cooperation with the sample studio and testing team if applicable.
Athelete services related tasks
Create and maintain Athlete Servicing specific calendars
Manages product creation related task in relevant systems (toolbox set up, management and article creation)
Be responsible for custom product execution in close cooperation with respective inline teams, in-house sample facilities and factories, based on Athlete Services manager briefing and tuning doc

 
Key Relationships: 

Creation Center – Marketing, Design, Product Development, Materials Development
Liaison Office/Operations Center – Merchandiser, Tech Service
Tier 1 supplier – Merchandising and Patternmaking
Fit & Wear Testing department, innovation teams
External CAD and Fit partners
Athlete Services Apparel

 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 

Advanced knowledge in pattern creation and grading with the ability to provide effective, and cost-efficient pattern solutions and an understanding of apparel construction, material construction and properties related to fit
Ability to interpret and evaluate designs on model level regarding pattern execution/engineering and related testing
Advanced knowledge of garment construction, manufacturing and production 
Strong team player/communicator with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects under multiple deadlines
Ability to work independently under minimal guidance on several projects simultaneously whilst adhering to a specified deadline 
Ability to effectively present information and trainings in one-on-one and large group situations to vendors, designers, and other employees of the organization
Ability to work with diverse groups, motivate or mentor others and a proven skill at problem solving and innovation
Effective written and verbal communication skills in English
Functional project management experience
Advanced skills in Gerber or similar CAD programs 
Advanced knowledge in CLO 3D or similar 3D programs is an advantage
Advanced IT skills in MS Office, Adobe applications and ability to work with Product Data Management Systems
Ability to travel, domestic or international, as required (approx. twice a year)

 
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications: 

Technical college/fashion school/university degree in pattern making / grading, “Meisterbrief” or equivalent education
Minimum of 2 years related work experience in apparel pattern engineering

Job Title: Manager Profit Protection (m/f/d) - Global Retail - Retail Operations
Job Description:
PURPOSE
The Manager Profit Protection (Data Analytics) is tasked with supporting the execution and integration of risk data analytics within Global Retail under the guidance of the Director Profit Protection (Retail Operations).
Profit Protection team members are value-adding business partners to Global Retail focused on supporting adidas in creating a sound governance, risk and compliance framework which mitigates risk and reduces loss.
 
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

In support of Director Profit Protection, implements the risk data analytics roadmap, ensuring compliance with industry best practices:

 



Manage the day-to-day operations within Exception Based Reporting for Global Retail POS Transactional Data.
Manage 3rd party analysis operations through the nominated adidas provider (Infosys), ensuring adherence to operational SLA’s.
Monitor EBR (Exception Based Reporting) functionality ensuring SLAs are met in full and systems are always fully operational.
Support DTC led analysis including the integration of OMNI data sources, including eCOM.
Build and develop extensive analytics reporting that includes automated reports that can be utilized by Market Retail/Profit Protection.
Proactively escalate and improve risk programs by identifying where data analytics can automate manually intensive tasks or where analysis of full population of data provides greater assurance and efficiencies



 

Complete quarterly quality assessments and fact-based documentation for Data Privacy purposes, including System User Access reviews and other elements defined within Profit Protection SLA’s / Standard Operating Accountabilities.
Obtain breadth of understanding of key processes and in-depth knowledge of key adidas applications (e.g., SAP, RFID, , Power BI).
Drive the integration of risk into Retail systems (RFID, mPOS, SCO) to leverage opportunities to mitigate risk and drive operational efficiencies.
Support education and upskilling of Retail members to improve interpretation of data via usage of Profit Protection tools (e.g., EBR, RFID, Resolver).
Develop analytic visualizations to create more compelling visuals that highlight impactful insights which are easier to consume for key stakeholders.  
Act as a point of contact for Retail members and associated stakeholders.

  
KEY RELATIONSHIPS

Profit Protection teams and related reporting lines (Retail & Finance functions)
Global Retail functions
TECH / InfoSec
Organizations within the “Aligned Assurance functions”, including Risk Management, Group Policies,Internal Controls, Legal and Compliance and CIA (Corporate, Internal Audit)
External vendors/solution providers

 
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Highly results driven and self-motivated team player with compassion, integrity, trust, and perseverance.
Able to accept and meet deadlines, involving effective time management capacity and sense of priorities and agility.
Strong analytic capabilities and effective listening skills to collect and manage large volume of information from various sources (interviews, data) and derive meaningful observations. 
Solid interpersonal skills combined with a high degree of customer orientation to navigate easily within complex organization, to connect with people, and management styles across different cultures and communicate technical IT / data topics to non-technical personnel
Curious and growth mindset; keen to learn and approach subjects outside of comfort zone, look beyond the obvious.
A passion for detail, accuracy, reliability, and speed coupled with desire for data exploration to reveal deeper insights, business process improvement opportunities and areas of potential risk.
Effective English presentation and communication skills (verbal and in written) and composure in conveying information.
Strong software knowledge with Microsoft Office suite.
Ideally, experience with data visualization platforms (e.g., Power BI). 
Additional language skills a value-add benefit (e.g., German). 

 
QUALIFICATIONS
 

Commerce/Business Administration/Finance/ Controlling/Mathematics background
5+ years’ work experience within data analytics field
Experience working within Profit Protection / Internal Controls / Risk Management / Retail functions
Experience working with Exception Based Reporting / RFID systems
Practical experience with data extraction and analytics tools.

Job Title: Senior Manager Corporate Controlling- Cash Flow / OWC (m/f/d)
Job Description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization: 
Our aspiration as the Finance function at adidas is to be a reliable business partner for the Brand, GOPS, as well as markets and channels driving growth and value creation. As a central element within the Finance organization, Corporate Controlling drives financial steering and decision making through high-quality financial reporting, analysis and planning. The Corporate FP&A team covers all aspects of financial reporting to Management and Supervisory Board, leads the company’s financial forecasting and planning process, as well as the Free Cashflow (‘FCF’) forecast and monthly actual reporting.
 
The overall purpose of this position is to act as a financial consultant for the Corporate Controlling organization and drive all aspects of the company-wide financial reporting, controlling, planning and management of all Free Cashflow items, including a special focus on operating working capital (‘OWC’, accounts receivable, net inventory, accounts payables). The employee is responsible for the end-to-end indirect FCF process by preparing adequate reporting, analysis and recommendations considering the Operating Profit, other cash-relevant P&L elements and balance sheet changes. The aim is to provide transparency and insights to the Senior Leadership Team to drive both operational and strategic decision-making and influence the Cashflow across the organization and markets.
 
 
Key Responsibilities:

Responsibility for the end-to-end indirect FCF process regarding monthly actual reporting and regular forecasting process, including the function as key point of contact for the company-wide indirect free cash flow process 
Drive best in class analytics, procedures and processes in relation to all FCF-relevant topics
Support in the long-term simulations, scenario modelling and target setting activities regarding FCF and OWC items
Main contact person and interface to other Corporate Finance teams with significant influence on the Company’s FCF, such as Corporate Tax, Corporate Treasury and Corporate Accounting, as well as the respective Market Finance teams
Support in the ongoing improvement of the design and definition of the company-wide indirect Free Cash Flow structure and process
Enable fact-based and efficient decision-making process by providing comprehensive and insightful financial analysis and simulations and derived balanced recommendations on all relevant FCF items (incl. OWC) to the Finance Senior Leadership/Executive Team
Develop, run and further improve result-oriented communication packages to present derived results, insights and recommendations relating to FCF and OWC
Development, implementation and ongoing improvement of cash flow-relevant KPIs (incl. OWC) and ongoing monitoring, reporting and management of those KPIs
Act as interface to the Integrated Business Planning and Market Finance teams to align on Inventory KPI Targets, Reporting, & Forecasting
Interface to FP&A planning team to align on OWC Targets, Reporting and Forecasting
Monitoring target and forecast compliance in relation to FCF and OWC items and follow-up on any deviations with the markets and other responsible corporate functions
Engage with markets, corporate functions and Corporate Finance teams to align on planning assumptions and to drive forecast accuracy and accountability
Drive the creation of regular and ad-hoc presentations and analysis
Leading medium-sized projects and taking an active role in bigger projects, including implementing the results and ensuring the sustainability of the results
Drive continuous improvement in the area of own responsibility 

 
Key Relationships: 

SVP Corporate Controlling and respective Senior Management/Leadership Team
Vice President Corporate FP&A
Corporate Finance Leadership Team, including Vice Presidents for Corporate Treasury, Corporate Tax and Corporate Accounting 
Other Corporate Controlling teams (e.g. Sales and Market Finance, HQ Finance)
Finance and demand planning functions in Markets

 
Knowledge Skills and Abilities: 

Excellent analytical mindset and skills and affinity for working with numbers, including managing large amounts of data from various sources
Experience with the indirect cashflow method and the management and forecasting of different Cashflow items
Corporate Finance experience and comprehensive expertise with analysis of financial data (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow metrics)
Good knowledge of IFRS and accounting standards is a plus
Experience with complex international companies in matrix organizations (preferably experience in the sporting goods industry) including a basic understanding of demand planning and sourcing processes
Strong problem-solving skills and mindset including ability to draw to-the-point conclusions and recommendations
Ability to work cross-functionally and independently within a global and changing environment, considering the complexity, interactions and dynamics within an international organization
Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills, including the ability to mediate and drive consensus across cross-functional stakeholders and teams with differing objectives 
Comprehensive business understanding of processes, structures and IT systems, including an understanding of external business drivers 
Very good communication skills to appropriately serve and manage senior leadership team and cross-functional business leaders and stakeholders
Comprehensive understanding of system landscape with strong PowerPoint, Excel skills and general MS office skills
Good planning and organization skills, including project management skills 
Process-orientated and end-to-end mindset driven
Fluent in English (written and spoken)

 
 
 
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:  

Advanced degree or qualification in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or Accounting
Minimum of 6-8 years’ experience in Accounting / Controlling / Reporting within an international company
Track record of outstanding performance in education and career

· Erhält ein ansprechendes, angenehmes Umfeld aufrecht, in dem die Kunden gerne einkaufen und achtet dabei auf Visual Merchandising sowie Ordnung und Sauberkeit
· Hält sich an die Regeln und Abläufe (SOM-Regelungen), die für den Store gelten und erhält eine sichere Einkaufs- und Arbeitsatmosphäre aufrecht
· Stellt sicher, dass das Warenangebot für den Kunden verfügbar ist, indem er/sie hilft, wenn Ware geliefert wurde und die Verkaufsfläche aufgefüllt werden muss
· Minimiert Verluste, indem er/sie beim Bedienen von Kunden immer auf den Warenbestand achtet
· Arbeitet neue Mitarbeiter/-innen ein (falls zutreffend)
· Arbeitet produktiv und respektvoll mit Teammitgliedern zusammen, um die Ziele des Stores zu erreichen oder zu übertreffen
· Absolviert alle vorgeschriebenen Trainingsprogramme und wendet diese erfolgreich bei seiner/ihrer Arbeit an
· Signalisiert fortwährende Lernbereitschaft und nutzt alle angebotenen Möglichkeiten, um seine/ihre Entwicklung voranzutreiben und seine/ihre Performance zu verbessern
· Kassiertätigkeit (falls zutreffend)
o Stellt korrekte Bezahlungsabläufe inkl. sorgsamer Warenhandhabung sicher
o Führt Kassenabschlüsse sorgfältig durch
o Schließt Verkäufe schnell und exakt ab und hält sich an die vorgegebenen Richtlinien zur Sicherung des Geldbestandes (falls zutreffend)
· Endless Aisle (falls zutreffend) Informiert Kunden über die neue Bestell-/Verkaufsmöglichkeit im Online Shop und verwendet das Endless Aisle Tablet um Produktbeschreibungen und/oder Kundenfeedback über Produkte während dem Verkaufsprozess anzubieten.
· Click & Collect (falls zutreffend) Überwacht und überschaut neue Onlinebestellungen, die von Onlinekunden bestellt wurden und im Laden reserviert, gepackt und an den Kunden im Laden ausgegeben werden müssen.
· Ship from Store (falls zutreffend) Überwacht und überschaut neue Onlinebestellungen, die an die Kunden per Lieferung geschickt werden müssen.

· NA

· Kunden
· Kollegen/-innen und Vorgesetzte

· Kompetenzen eines Retail Professionals
· Erwartungsheft für RP
 
Benötigte Ausbildung und Erfahrung / Mindestanforderung:
 
· 0-3 Jahre Retail Erfahrung
· Ausbildung zum Verkäufer wünschenswert
· Englisch Grundkenntnisse
· Grundlegende Rechtschreib- und Rechenkenntnisse, Kommunikationsfähigkeit

Job Title: Senior Sales & Business Analyst - Temp until end of 2026(m/f/d)
Job Description:
Purpose:
 
The general purpose of Sales Development Business Analytics is to be a data-driven consultant to the Central Senior Management and Sales Teams by providing insights & recommendations to enable and drive fact-based decisions. The Business Analytics Functions support and steer the business to achieve sales targets as well as the strategy by creating a holistic reporting landscape and analyzing relevant KPIs. This team acts as a partner function to provide support, guidance and clarity to all sales teams, as well as General Management.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 

First point of contact for assigned Key-Account Sales Team to provide analytical insights and recommendations.
Pro-active & Independent monitoring and reporting of sales data (Sell-In and Sell-Out)
Identification of market specific developments and trends as well as preparation of re-order proposals for specific accounts
Monitor and analyze the impact of campaigns (sell-out)
Identification of slow-sellers and best-sellers as well as order cancellation and return processes
Provide analytical insights to support Sell-In and Pre-Order business (follow up of deadlines e.g., cut-off dates and track order intake)
Developing and maintaining innovative, scalable reporting tools to create better business understanding within the organization.
Presenting and discussing business developments with the sales teams internally and customers externally on regular basis
Conducting market & competitor analysis and following market & competitor activities (campaigns, Special Sales offers etc.) to enable 360° explanations for Sell Out developments and create best possible fact based Sales recommendations to the account managers 
Support in cross functional projects, e.g., Forecasting, Budget, Trade Terms, IBP
Supporting excellence-processes within account teams, creating fact books, preparing T2T- and customer meetings.
Train Account Manager in using standardized reporting tools (e.g., Microstrategy, Power BI)

 
 
People Management:
 

Managing all direct reports as an integrated team by setting targets, goals and guiding principles for the team.
Creating a high-performance culture and managing the career and succession planning of key talents
Inspiring, leading and fostering a high performance culture within the team
Ensure cooperation and collaboration between all staff and departments
Developing direct reports' core functional and interpersonal competencies through regular coaching and mentoring
Provide leadership based on the Leadership Framework and Brand Values
Continuously assessing employees through the official adidas Performance Management process
Ensure succession plans for all relevant positions within own team
Continuous development and support of defined talents in the team 

 
 
Key Relationships:
 

Key-Account Sales-Teams
Sales Development
Finance, Controlling
Go-To-Market (CtC), WHS Activation, and Brand Activation
Customer Service
TECH / DNA

 
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
 

Deep understanding of numbers and excellent analytical skills
Comfort with Sales/Product Data and very good understanding of sales KPIs
Data driven mindset and attention to detail.
Strong Problem-solving abilities, 
Good understanding of operational processes
Open-minded, with excellent interpersonal skills and 
Team-Player
Ability to manage time effectively and work on multiple tasks simultaneously.
Very good knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
 Knowledge of Power BI is advantageous.
Good communication and presentation skills
Fluent in both English and German, both written and spoken.

 
 
Requisite Education and Experience/Minimum Qualifications:
 

Degree in business administration (bachelor/master) 
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in sales, or marketing or finance/controlling

Experience/interests: sports, sales, marketing in the clothing/fashion/footwear or FMCG industry.

Job Title: Senior Administrative Assistant - Footwear Production
Job Description:
Zweck & Gesamtrelevanz für die Organisation:
 
Sicherstellen der administrativen Unterstützung des Vorgesetzten sowie der Abteilung.
 
Verantwortlichkeiten: 
 

Wahrnehmen des routinemäßigen Schriftverkehrs, um eine termingerechte und zielgenaue Reaktion sicherzustellen 
Formatieren, eingeben und bearbeiten verschiedener Materialien wie Schriftverkehr, Memos, Protokolle, Berichte und vertrauliche Dokumente
Pflegen und aktualisieren von Akten, Dateien, Aufzeichnungen, Organigrammen und anderen graphischen Darstellungen
Telefonanrufe annehmen und sondieren, eingehende Post kontrollieren und den E-Mail-Account der Abteilung verwalten 
Unterstützen des Teams beim Erstellen von Ankündigungen und Newslettern
Mitwirken bei der Erstellung/Überarbeitung von Präsentationen
Interne und externe Besprechungen/Konferenzen planen, inkl. Raumbuchungen
Organisieren, Koordinieren und Abwickeln sämtlicher Reisen für die Mitarbeiter des Teams, einschließlich der Flug- und Hotelbuchungen, Beantragung von Visa, Fahrzeugreservierungen und Vorkehrungen für die Abholung vom Flughafen, sowie die üblichen Probleme in diesem Zusammenhang termingerecht lösen
Erstellen von Reisekostenabrechnungen
Bearbeiten der Kostenstellen der Abteilung, einschließlich der regelmäßige Überwachung der Budgets, Freigabe von Rechnung zur Gewährleistung korrekter Buchhaltungsvorgänge 
Wichtigste Kontaktperson für das Informationsmanagement (z. B. im Intranet), sicherstellen, dass der Inhalt des Intranets aktuell ist
Mitwirken bei und koordinieren von Projekten und Aufgaben wie gefordert/angewiesen, z.B. Zeitwirtschaft und Personalplanung 
Durchführen von operativen Aufgaben unter Aufsicht der jeweilig beauftragenden Abteilung 
Unterstützung des Teams und des Managements

 
Allgemeine Aufgaben:

Bestellen von Bürobedarf

Job Title: Senior Manager Finishing & Sample Competence Center (m/w/d)
Job Description:

Ensure excellence in executing all Finishing and Sample Competence Center (SCC) related processes and activities in line with the internal and external customer expectations and priorities considering the available resources while caring the wellbeing, motivation and development of the team.     
 
 
Key Responsibilities:  
 


Ensure a proper planning and coordination considering the capacity requests from Internal and External Customers 




Own end-to-end processes and projects within the area of Finishing and SCC 




Ensure proper and timely delivery of all necessary samples aligned with requested dates, locations, and conditions 




Lead on-site Finishing and SCC teams by operational and disciplinary means 




Ensure the Compliance, Health, and Safety of the team and the department according to the adidas Global Standard 




Care the well-being, development, and motivation of the team 




Act as SPOC for related project implementation as well as collaboration with other departments

Support decision-making for ongoing projects

SEF Works Council 




Shoe Production, M2M, adiLab 




HR 




Security 




Logistics 




UFF and SEF2 




GSM, PRS, Sales, Quality Lab, adidas Innovation Team, Athlete Services 




Controlling

Versicherungsangebote 
Essen- und Fahrtkostenzuschuss 
Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm (Aktien) 
Pensionsplan und Frührentenfinanzierung

Job Title: Senior Manager Global SCM Outbound (m/f/d) temp 18 months
Job Description:
Purpose
 
This role is an amazing opportunity to work in a cross functional environment in which you will be responsible for providing visibility on outbound performance and project portfolio to senior leadership.
As a member of the Global Outbound Transportation Team, you will bring technical innovation while identifying efficiency and process excellence opportunities with a keen focus on our regional market operations. 
Through your technical knowledge on digital innovation and Supply Chain processes, you will become a key element in the successful delivery of our key Outbound improvement initiatives.
 
Key Responsibilities Central Intelligence
Data and Performance 

Maintain/Define, Measure and Analyze standardized performance metrics and tools.
Improve and Gain control on Global Outbound key metrics to support markets Service Level while delivering efficiency in their operations.
Drive outbound performance analysis incl. preparation of global reports, analysis of carrier portfolio, capacity needs vs secured, etc,
Drive data and root-cause analysis to identify efficiency and cost saving opportunities
Support Director Global Outbound in development of annual freight cost forecasting 

Projects

Maintain visibility on project portfolio for the global outbound team
Provide executional support to markets in case of burning issues
Lead and support key Global Outbound digital and business transformation projects such as, digital roll-out of multi-carrier management platform, transportation management solution (TMS), and yard management solutions

Systems

Act as Business Project Manager for roll-out of digitization initatives such multi-carrier management platform, transportation management solution, and yard management solutions
Identify and review business requirements to feed to Product Owner for configuration and customization 
Become a subject matter expert in outbound digitization for our market teams, defining and implementing new processes based on solution functionalities and ensure highest level of productivity

Community

Build and actively manage outbound logistics expert network for exchange of best practices

 
Key Responsibilities Market SPOC

Drive market performance analysis incl. preparation of reports, analysis of carrier failures, comparison of capacity needs and capacity secured, etc.
Work with market outbound on resolution of major carrier performance failures
Work with market outbound on adoption of global frameworks incl. performance mgmt, carrier mgmt, capacity planning, etc.
Review fit of carrier portfolio per market with procurement and market outbound
Review fit of capacity secured vs. need with outbound market Lead
Engage in carrier performance review for major local carriers
Support ad hoc projects incl. conceptualization and project mgmt

 
Key Relationships

Outbound Transportation and DC operations teams
Global Inbound Transportation
Distribution IT
IT (Tech)
Finance/Controlling
Project Management
Procurement
Key carriers
External consultants (as needed)

 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Demonstrated project management skills
Ability to lead and influence without formal reporting line
Ability to analyze and synthesize complex data sets
Ability to think strategically and develop innovative solutions
Ability to be self-directed while working under tight deadlines
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with different international cultures
Strong communication, facilitation and presentation skills to all levels of the organization
Strong communication (both written and verbal) and facilitation skills (small and large groups) especially when interacting with different levels of business
Ability to travel, domestic or international, as required
Fluent English (verbal and written), 
Strong MS-Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), 

 
Requisite Education and Experience 

Four-year college or university degree with focus on Supply Chain Management
Minimum 5+ year experience in supply chain and outbound transport, and/ or management consulting
Extensive knowledge of ground transportation modes (parcel, pallet, LTL/FTL) in the consumer goods industry with emphasis on direct to consumer (DTC)
Understanding of the bigger picture and end-to-end supply chain with the focus on transportation (DC to customer, consumer)
Recent experience and current knowledge of Transportation systems capabilities, and technology platforms (real-time visibility, TMS, carrier integration platforms, yard management solutions)
Vast experience in multi-national supply chain/logistics/transportation work experience in fast moving consumer goods industry (preferably apparel, fashion background).
Proven track record in driving change

Job Description:
Zweck & Gesamtrelevanz für die Organisation:

Leisten eines Beitrags zum Erreichen bzw. Übertreffen der Umsatz- und Gewinnziele der Stores durch 
Gewährleistung der effizienten und effektiven Umsetzung der europäischen Visual Merchandising 
Ausrichtung in zugewiesenen Stores.

Hauptverantwortungsbereiche:
Kommunikation:

Kaskadieren von Informationen des Markt VM Managers an den SM sowie die Store-Mitarbeiter mittels Trainings und Meetings.
Teilnahme an Teammeetings und ‚Huddles‘, um die Bedürfnisse zu verstehen und dem Regional VMM 
Feedback zu den Anforderungen des Stores zu geben.


Merchandising Display:

Gewährleisten, dass die Stores die europäischen Standards und Richtlinien einhalten und damit allen Konsumenten ein Marken-Shopping-Erlebnis bieten.
Gewährleisten, dass alle Schaufenster erstklassig präsentiert werden, einschließlich Outfit und Positionierung von Schaufensterpuppen, Beleuchtung, Sauberkeit, Bedampfung und Preisangaben.
Verantwortung für das Einrichten von klar abgetrennten ‚Shop-in-Shops‘, um die kategoriespezifische Präsentation hervorzuheben.
Sicherstellen der korrekten Nutzung und Positionierung von In-Store Communication Tools.

Job Title: Manager Tech Infrastructure (m/f/d)
Job Description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization:
 
Market business expects solid and best in class infrastructure support services, service management and project delivery. The Manager Tech Infrastructure will contribute heavily on seamless running of IT services (day to day support) as well as project delivery (opening, closing & revamp activities) across a specific adidas market.
 
He/she is also supporting the service quality of all end user services (e.g. Connectivity, Service Desk, Onsite Support a.k.a. Field Services and End Device Management) in order to deliver the right level of cross functional- or team services and actively participating with the Domain Product Owners and Business Partners on any Infrastructure related project and support service.
 
Key Responsibilities: 
 
Continual Improvement
 

Expect to support continual improvement initiatives and promote collaboration with relevant Domain Service Owners to highlight and contribute towards improvement activities.

 
Relationship Management
 

Your scope will be within a specific adidas market where you will be expected to foster good stakeholder engagement/communications. Collect and use feedback from corporate business users to increase quality of stakeholder management. You will be managing expectations of the stakeholders to ensure everyone is understanding and updated on agreed level of our service.

 
 
Service Level Management
 

Monitors service delivery performance metrics and liaises with managers and customers to ensure that service level agreements are not breached without the stakeholders being given the opportunity of planning for a deterioration in service.

 
Demand Management
 

Expect to receive and consolidate relevant market specific Tech Infrastructure demand and liaises with managers into further execution.  

Project Management

You will be in charge of the various infrastructure projects (openings, closings & revamp) which needs to be executed on time, in full and in budget.
Included might be budget utilization for break & fix replacement as well as end of life replacements of Tech hardware.
In addition, strong PM collaboration is needed with Tech Core Domain Project Management to execute on priority any projects that might come from domain side within your market.

If required: Supplier Management 
 

You could be expected to engage with local vendors to ensure that contractual agreements are compliant, measured and adhered to as well as proposing and tracking vendor performance.

Service Management
 
Incident Management
 

Following agreed procedures, identifies, registers, and categorizes incidents. 
Gathers information to enable incident resolution and promptly allocates incidents as appropriate.
Maintains records and advises relevant persons of actions taken.

Problem Management
 

Investigates problems in systems, processes, and services. 
Assists with the implementation of agreed remedies and preventative measures.

 
 
 
If required: People Management / Resource Management: 

Supports resource planning and have responsibility in recruiting process. 
Recommend and support in allocating the different work to the respective employees considering experience, complexity, workload and organizational efficiency
Continuously monitors and evaluates team workload and organizational efficiency with the support of Tech systems, data and analysis and team feedback and makes appropriate changes to meet business needs.
Provides team members/direct reports with clear instruction and targets that are aligned with driving business value and Tech objectives. 

Key Relationships: 
 

Global Infrastructure (Tech Core) Service Owners for service improvements and vendor performance metrics
SPOC to local business team leads around overall service performance & escalation mgmt.
External Service Providers for service review and service quality improvements.

 
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications: 
 

Four-year college or university degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Proficient spoken and written command of English 
At least 5-year experience in IT 
2 years of experience in Infrastructure IT services & project management
1 years of experience in team management
Understanding of different culture
Participated in projects with people from other functions/markets

Job Title: Senior Manager Real Estate Central / Cross Border - Europe (M/F/D)
Job Description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organisation
 
This role is responsible for maximizing the profitability of Market Europe Retail & Franchise by securing Real Estate in Central (+ cross border) in alignment with adidas retail store growth targets for European Markets. This role will be responsible for identifying potential sites, evaluating their feasibility, negotiating leases, and ensuring that financial objectives are achieved in the development of adidas retail locations. It will support the integrated Distribution Roadmap to optimize our store structure within the marketplace. Additionally, this position will manage corporate landlord relations to enhance deal-making and ensure both our franchisees and our Own Retail business benefit from the company's scale.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
•    Identify and evaluate all real estate opportunities through site visits, site selection metrics and criteria, demographic analysis and research to ensure the best locations for the brand are secured.
•    Contribute to the creation of strategic market growth plan, including store growth targets, target markets, etc. for Central/Cross-border.
•    Support the creation of metrics and criteria for which site selection decisions will be made (research analytics, financial performance, revenue prediction models).
•    Negotiate Head of Terms with landlords and make sure commercial and corporate requirements are reflected in the final lease agreement. 
•    Work with various retail departments to attain internal alignment on site opportunities and sales projections.
•    Present adidas retail concepts to prospective landlords 
•    Steer external Real Estate resources (brokers, landlords, developers, lawyers, etc.) 
•    Manage the creation of site justification packets as part of the capital approval processes.
•    Manage the existing store portfolio to actively drive rent reductions, recommend lease renewals and terminations and negotiate renewals and extensions where appropriate. Monthly update and review the portfolio overview.
 
Key Relationships
 
•    Internal - Real Estate department, Retail Store Development, Retail Store Operations, Finance, Merchandising, Marketing, HR
•    External - Landlords, brokers, industry developers and operators, architects, legal partners, general contractors
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
 
•    Management ability and competency to manage landlords, brokers, developers and operators 
•    Strong inside knowledge process management of in store implementation, architects, regional sourcing, legal partners, and general contractors.
•    Ability to maximize relationships with developers and landlords in real estate community.
•    Ability to think strategically, define business opportunities and problems, collect, interpret and analyze abstract and concrete information, and create strategic, value-add solutions.
•    Intermediate to advanced experience with detailed demographic analysis.
•    Ability to travel up to 75% of the time, and in some cases with limited notice.
•    Strong retail business acumen (operational and fiscal).
•    Strong presentation and communication skills.
•    Excellent negotiation skills and ability to influence others.
•    Strong organizational skills.
•    Proficiency with MS applications (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and other computer software (Internet, POS Systems, etc).
•    Ability to speak, read and write English and German fluently; additional language skills beneficial
 
Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications
 
•    Bachelor’s degree (B.A.), with an emphasis in real estate or finance / MBA preferred.
•    4-6 years retail specific real estate site selection experience, preferably with a major retailer 
•    Minimum of 3 years’ experience managing/negotiating external consultants and contractors
•    Strong relationships and credibility within the retail real estate industry of Germany

Job Title: Ausbildung Schuhfertiger/-in (m/w/d) in Scheinfeld 2025
Job Description:
AUSBILDUNG SCHUHFERTIGER/-IN (M/W/D) IN SCHEINFELD
 
WAS MACHST DU ALS SCHUHFERTIGER/-IN? 
Du träumst davon, mit deinen eigenen Händen High-Performance-Schuhe für Spitzensportler/innen wie Lionel Messi, Jude Bellingham, Florian Wirtz oder Olga Carmona zu fertigen? Oder hast du den Wunsch, später als Schuhentwickler/in oder Schuhkonstrukteur/in Entwürfe, Zeichnungen und Renderings unserer Designer in reale Produkte umzusetzen? Dann ist die Ausbildung zum/r Schuhfertiger/in genau das Richtige für dich. 
Mit der Ausbildung erlernst du nicht nur ein echtes Handwerk, sondern legst auch den Grundstein für eine (inter)nationale Karriere als Fach- oder Führungskraft in der Sportartikelindustrie. Nach erfolgreicher Ausbildung kommt eine Beschäftigung bei uns in der Maßfertigung für Spitzensportler/innen in Betracht oder eine Weiterbildung zum/zur staatlich geprüften Schuhtechniker/in, welche von uns finanziell und fachlich unterstützt wird.  
 
Nach erfolgreicher Weiterbildung stehen dir dann auch in der Produktentwicklung alle Türen offen – es kommen Beschäftigungen an unserem Produktionsstandort Scheinfeld, in unserem Konzernsitz in Herzogenaurach oder in weiteren Produktionsstätten in Asien in Betracht.  
 
Komm‘ zu uns und unterstütze uns auf diesem spannenden Weg! 
 
Hier findest du weitere Informationen in unserem Video über die Ausbildung zum/-r Schuhfertiger/-in: Apprenticeship as a shoemaker at adidas (vimeo.com)
 
WAS LERNST DU IN DER AUSBILDUNG? DU ... 
 


durchläufst alle wichtigen Aufgabenbereiche: vom Zuschnitt und das Steppen von Leder, das Kennenlernen und Einsetzen verschiedener Bodenteile, die Materialkunde, sowie auch die End- und Qualitätskontrolle der fertigen Produkte 



erlernst die Herstellung eines Schuhs von A-Z
lernst anhand von bekannten adidas-Modellen das Beurteilen von Werkstoffen & das Zuschneiden, Nähen und Zusammenfügen von Schuhteilen
stellst im Bodenbau aus deinen Schuhteilen fertige Schuhe her
kontrollierst deine Arbeiten regelmäßig mit erfahrenen Mitarbeitern und Kollegen und erhältst Tipps und Tricks
lernst ständig neue Dinge über die Schuhproduktion in verschiedenen Bereichen, z.B. Made2Measure, ...
rotierst innerhalb von adidas durch verschiedene Bereiche und Teams

 
WAS KOMMT NACH DER AUSBILDUNG? 
Mit der Schuhfertiger/in Ausbildung legst du den Grundstein für eine nationale/ internationale Karriere – hier kommen unterschiedliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in Betracht: vom Schuhmacher/in für Spitzenathleten oder in der Produktion in Scheinfeld oder nach erfolgreicher Weiterbildung zu Schuhtechniker*in auch in der Schuhentwicklung, sowohl in Scheinfeld, in Herzogenaurach oder in weiteren Produktionsstätten in Asien.  
Die Weiterbildung zum staatlichen geprüften Schuhtechniker*in fördern wir intensiv. 
 
WAS SOLLTEST DU MITBRINGEN? 


Qualifizierter Schulabschluss (Mittelschule, Realschule oder Gymnasium) oder Quereinsteiger mit einem Interesse an einer Weiterentwicklung 




Interesse an der Schuhfertigung  




Handwerkliches Geschick und technisches Verständnis 


 
WAS KÖNNEN WIR DIR BIETEN? 


Übernahmegarantie bei guter Leistung im Betrieb und in der Berufsschule, sehr gute Entwicklungs- und Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten, übertarifliche Vergütung (1. Lehrjahr: 1244,- €; 2. Lehrjahr: 1346,- €; 3. Lehrjahr: 1374,- €) 




Weitere Benefits wie Vermögenswirksame Leistungen, Fahrtkostenzuschuss, Mitarbeiteraktienprogramm und Mitarbeiterrabatt und diverse Sportmöglichkeite 




Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten, darunter Sprachkurse, Mentoring und ein Learning Campus 




Teilnahme an coolen Projekten und Workshops mit anderen Future Talents 




Ein einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld mit internationalen Teams 


 
 
WIE KANNST DU DICH BEWERBEN? 
ÜBERRASCHE UNS – Zeige uns, warum du zu adidas möchtest und deine Motivation für diesen Ausbildungsberuf.  
 
Anstatt des üblichen Anschreibens kannst du dich hierfür ganz individuell vorstellen. Dabei sind deiner Kreativität keine Grenzen gesetzt, ob nun zum Beispiel eine Präsentation, Märchen, Video oder Zeitungsinterview, wir wollen dich näher und vor allem besser kennenlernen. Wichtig ist, dass es digital - entweder als Anhang oder Link - verfügbar ist.  
 
Zusätzlich brauchen wir deinen Lebenslauf, sowie deine letzten beiden Schulzeugnisse und ggf. weitere relevante Zertifikate und Bestätigungen. Bei zu großen Dateien, füge einfach den Link zur Datei (z.B. Dropbox, YouTube) deinem Lebenslauf hinzu. 
 
Bewerberinnen und Bewerber mit Behinderungen sind willkommen und werden bei gleicher Eignung besonders berücksichtigt. 
 
FACTS & FIGURES 


Startschuss – 1. September 2025 (Dauer 3 Jahre) 




Einsatzort – adidas AG, Scheinfeld 




Berufsschule – Pirmasens (Reise- und Unterkunftskosten werden von adidas, für die Dauer des Blockunterrichts, übernommen) 




Bewerbungsschluss – Solange die Stelle online ausgeschrieben ist, akzeptieren wir Bewerbungen 




Kontakt – Unser Recruiter Imran steht dir für Fragen zur Verfügung 


 
Du willst noch mehr über den Beruf erfahren? Online findest du viele weitergehende Informationen zu dieser Ausbildung.

Job Title: Ausbildung Textil- und Modeschneider/-in (m/w/d) 2025
Job Description:
AUSBILDUNG TEXTIL- UND MODESCHNEIDER/-IN (M/W/D) 2025
 
 
WAS MACHST DU ALS TEXTIL- UND MODESCHNEIDER/-IN? 
Wir bringen niemals ein Produkt auf den Markt, wenn wir es nicht für perfekt halten. 
Hast du dich schon immer gefragt, wer die Vorstellungen der Designer umsetzt und wie am Ende ein fertiges Kleidungsstück entsteht? 
 
Wenn die Idee erst einmal da ist, erstellen die Schnittmacher ein Schnittmuster. Dieses Schnittmuster wird dann von den Modeschneidern bei adidas in unserer Musternäherei zu einem Prototyp zusammengenäht und später optimiert. Wir kreieren jedes Shirt und jedes Ausrüstungsstück für Tausende von Sportlern und Modeliebhabern, als wäre es ein Unikat. Und das ist es auch, denn wir lassen unsere Leidenschaft in jedes einzelne Produkt einfließen. 
 
Komm zu uns und unterstütze uns auf diesem kreativen und spannenden Weg! 
 
WAS LERNST DU IN DER AUSBILDUNG? DU ... 


sammelst wertvolle Praxiserfahrungen für die Zukunft 




unterstützt bei der Fertigung von Prototypen und Musterteilen und beschäftigst dich mit der Durchführung von qualitätssichernden Maßnahmen sowie der Erstellung der entsprechenden Unterlagen 




lernst verschiedene Verarbeitungsweisen an diversen Produktgruppen 




arbeitest im manuellen und automatisierten Zuschnitt 




hast die Möglichkeit, dich im 3. Ausbildungsjahr auf die Serienfertigung, Qualitätssicherung oder Schnitt zu spezialisieren 


 
WAS KOMMT NACH DER AUSBILDUNG? 
Nach der Ausbildung hast du verschiedene Möglichkeiten dich bei adidas weiterzuentwickeln. Zum Beispiel kannst du eine Weiterbildung zum Schnitttechniker oder Bekleidungstechniker machen. Auch als Teammitglied unseres Sample Studios sammelst du wertvolle Berufserfahrung.  Das sind nur einige von vielen weiteren Möglichkeiten, die du in Anschluss an die Ausbildung hast. 
 
WAS SOLLTEST DU MITBRINGEN? 


Einen Schulabschluss, egal welchen 




Interesse an Mode und Textilien 




Handwerkliches Geschick, Fingerspitzengefühl und technisches Verständnis  




Motivation, Geduld, Teamfähigkeit, Einsatz- und Lernbereitschaft 


 
WAS KÖNNEN WIR DIR BIETEN?  


Übernahmegarantie bei guter Leistung im Betrieb und in der Berufsschule, gute Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten, übertarifliche Vergütung (1. Lehrjahr: 1244,- €; 2. Lehrjahr: 1346,- €; 3. Lehrjahr: 1374,- €) 




Weitere Benefits u.a. Vermögenswirksame Leistungen, Fahrtkostenzuschuss, Mitarbeiteraktienprogramm 




Diverse Sportmöglichkeiten (u.a. Fitnessstudio, Fußball-, Basketball- und Tennisplatz, Skatepark, Pool und ein breitgefächertes Company Sports Programm auf unserem Campus) 




Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Mitarbeiterrabatt 




Coole Projekte und Workshops mit anderen Future Talents, flexible Arbeitszeiten, ein einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld mit einem sehr internationalen Team  


 
WIE KANNST DU DICH BEWERBEN? 
ÜBERRASCHE UNS – Zeige uns, warum du zu adidas möchtest und deine Motivation für diesen Ausbildungsberuf.  
 
Hierfür kannst du dich ganz individuell vorstellen. Traditionell mit einem Anschreiben oder auf eine kreative Weise. Deiner Kreativität sind keine Grenzen gesetzt, ob nun zum Beispiel eine Präsentation, Märchen, Video oder Zeitungsinterview, wir wollen dich näher und vor allem besser kennenlernen. Wichtig ist, dass es digital - entweder als Anhang oder Link - verfügbar ist. 
 
Zusätzlich brauchen wir deinen Lebenslauf, sowie deine letzten beiden Schulzeugnisse und ggf. weitere relevante Zertifikate und Bestätigungen. Bei zu großen Dateien, füge einfach den Link zur Datei (z.B. Dropbox, YouTube) deinem Lebenslauf hinzu. 
 
Bewerberinnen und Bewerber mit Behinderungen sind willkommen und werden bei gleicher Eignung besonders berücksichtigt. 
 
FACTS & FIGURES 


Startschuss – 1. September 2025 (Dauer 3 Jahre) 




Einsatzort – adidas World of Sports Herzogenaurach   




Berufsschule – Schweinfurt (Reise- und Unterkunftskosten werden von adidas, für die Dauer des Blockunterrichts, übernommen) 


Kontakt – Unser Recruiter Imran steht dir für Fragen zur Verfügung 


 
Du willst noch mehr über den Beruf erfahren? Online findest du viele weitergehende Informationen zu dieser Ausbildung.

Job Title: Visual Merchandiser (m/w/d), bis 31.07.25 - adidas Factory Outlet Halle/Leipzig, THE STYLE OUTLET
Job Description:
Zweck & Gesamtrelevanz für die Organisation:
Trägt durch folgendes zur Wirtschaftlichkeit des Stores bei:

Maximierung der Verkaufszahlen durch effektives Visual Merchandising, auch basierend auf wöchentlichen Zahlenanalysen wie Space Management Reports, Kategorieumsätzen und Bestseller Reports
Optimale Darstellung der Marke in einheitlichen und CI-gerechten Präsentationsstandards und unter Berücksichtigung des Retail Marketing Kalenders
Kontrolliert und coacht das Team in einem bestimmten Verantwortungsbereich

 
Verantwortlichkeiten: 
 

Teilt in seinem/ihrem Verantwortungsbereich Ressourcen ein und organisiert Abläufe, um Effizienz und Produktivität in verschiedenen Situationen zu steuern
Hat ausreichende Kenntnisse der Retail KPIs und trifft innerhalb seines/ihres Verantwortungsbereichs geschäftliche Entscheidungen
Passt und organisiert den allgemeinen saisonalen Visual Merchandising Prozess zur Aufrechterhaltung einheitlicher Sortimentspräsentations-Standards an
Passt Warenpräsentationen an die Warenverfügbarkeit an
Setzt die aktuellen VM-Standards um
Führt regelmäßige Morning-Trainings durch
Stellt und forciert Saisonhighlights 
Plant Aktionen in Kooperation mit der Marketingabteilung
Bereitet Events vor in Kooperation mit der Marketingabteilung
Gestaltet die Eventzone sowie die Umsetzung der Fenstergestaltung
Verantwortet die Einhaltung des Retail Marketing Kalenders
Trainiert die Mitarbeiter/innen in den Abteilungen in punkto Guidelines und Standards
Stimmt sich eng mit VM Market Central und dem Sales bzw. Floor Management ab
Verantwortet Struktur und Ordnung in der Bestellung, Annahme und Lagerung des gesamten Deko-Materials einschließlich der Grafiken und Fensteraufbauten und sorgt für sorgfältigen Umgang
Unterstützt aktiv das Verkaufsteam im Verkauf an Samstagen und außerhalb aktuell notwendiger VM-Maßnahmen
Verantwortet optimale Flächenausnutzung und –bewirtschaftung unter Space-Management Kriterien
Kontrolliert wöchentliche Analyse einzelner Umgestaltungen auf Verkaufserfolge; Marketingaktionen usw.
Schafft ein ansprechendes und einladendes Einkaufsumfeld durch beständige Koordination seines/ihres Teams zur Durchführung von Visual Merchandising und Sauberkeitsstandards
Hält ein sicheres Einkaufs- und Arbeitsumfeld aufrecht, indem er/sie sicher stellt, dass alle in seinem/ihrem Verantwortungsbereich die Regeln und Abläufe des Stores einhalten
Coacht, motiviert und inspiriert Menschen in seinem/ihrem Verantwortungsbereich, ihr Potenzial auszuschöpfen
Signalisiert Lernbereitschaft und nutzt alle vorhandenen Möglichkeiten, um seine/ihre Entwicklung voranzutreiben und seine/ihre Leistung zu verbessern
Ist jederzeit in der Lage, seine persönliche Organisation den Gegebenheiten und Erfordernissen flexibel und selbständig anzupassen

 
Befugnisse:

Stellvertretung des Store Managers / ASM in seiner/ihrer Abwesenheit (falls relevant & anwendbar)
Weisungsbefugnis im VM-Verantwortungsbereich
Führt Feedbackgespräche (falls relevant & anwendbar)
